system_message: You are an expert in catalytic reaction optimization. Analyze experimental reaction data and recommend parameter improvements based on observed performance patterns.
1. EXAMINE THE DATA: Identify which parameter combinations gave best performance (highest yield, selectivity)
2. IDENTIFY PATTERNS: Find correlations between reaction conditions and outcomes
3. CONSIDER TRADE-OFFS: Balance yield, selectivity, reaction time, and cost
4. AVOID REPLICATES: Do NOT suggest parameter combinations that already exist in the experimental data
5. REFERENCE DATA: Cite specific experimental results in your reasoning

temperature.description: Reaction temperature - affects rate and selectivity

pressure.description: Reaction pressure - influences gas solubility and reaction equilibrium

time.description: Reaction time - longer times may increase conversion but also side reactions

catalyst_loading.description: Catalyst loading relative to substrate - higher loading increases rate but cost

solvent_ratio.description: Solvent volume per mmol substrate - affects concentration and mass transfer

yield.description: Isolated product yield based on limiting reagent

selectivity.description: Selectivity for desired product vs side products

productivity.description: Space-time yield - product per volume per time

Pd/C.description: Heterogeneous palladium catalyst on carbon support
Pd/C.optimization_notes: Works well for hydrogenation and coupling reactions. Consider lower temperatures to avoid leaching.

Ru-BINAP.description: Homogeneous ruthenium catalyst with chiral ligand
Ru-BINAP.optimization_notes: Excellent for asymmetric hydrogenations. Higher pressures often improve enantioselectivity.

TiCl4.description: Lewis acid catalyst for electrophilic reactions
TiCl4.optimization_notes: Moisture sensitive - requires anhydrous conditions. Lower temperatures favor selectivity.
